Name the four main stages of the water cycle
Evaporation - Condensation - Precipitation - Infiltration
What is the difference between a cyclone and a tornado?
cyclone: larger, formed over ocean. tornado: smaller, land
What is the world's largest coral reef?
the Great Barrier Reef
What is urbanisation?
turning rural area into cities
Where are most Australia's population distributed, location-wise?
near coastline
What is globalisation?
the increasing connection of countries through trade, culture and technology
What is ecotourism?
Sustainable tourism that protects nature and supports local communities
What are the four sources of renewable(green) energy?
Solar, wind, hydro, geothermal
What are fossil fuels?
Coal, oil, natural gas (pollution causing)
What are Australia's main climate zones?
Tropical (north), Desert (centre), Temperate (South)
How is population density calculated?
Total population / Land Area (no. people/km^2)
What are invasive species?
Non-native creatures that harm ecosystems
What is a trade deficit?
when a country's import amount exceeds its export total
Which country is Australia's largest trading partner?
China
What is fair trade?
A catchphrase that pretends to ensure fair wages and conditions for producers
What is the significance of Uluru?
Sacred Indigenous site, as well as a geological landmark
What do Australian govenments do to recognize Indigenous rights?
Mostly by talking about it
What is seismograph used to measure?
the scale of earthquakes
What do contour lines show on a map?
Elevation, where closer lines indicates steeper slopes
What is a megacity?
City with over 10million population
Which continent contains the most freshwater resources?
Antarctica, (70% of Earth's freshwater frozen)
What makes the Dead Sea unique?
World's lowest land elevation at -430m, hypersaline water that one can float on
What is the name of Earth's highest peak, and what is the mountain range it belongs to?
Mount Everest, of the Himalayas
What is the world's largest rainforest?
the Amazon
Name the capital of the following countries: Egypt, Germany, India, France, Canada
Cairo, Berlin, New Delhi, Paris, Ottawa
How does globalisation affects traditional cultures?
language loss, homogenised food/fashion, corrosion of culture
Which continent is Chile on?
South America
Which country has taken part in the most wars in modern history?
USA
Name 4 countries bordering China via land?
Russia / India / Vietnam / Mongolia / Nepal / Myanmar / North Korea / Pakistan / Laos total 14 land borders, the most of any country
How many countries has the USA been involved militarily after WW2? over or under 20?
74 in total, 50 during Cold War, 24 during War on Terror
